intro: Dipterygia spinosissima, commonly known as the spiny dipterygia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
